Plain English in a familiar conference betwixt three friends, Rusticus, Civis, and Veridicus, concerning the deadness of our markets : offer'd as an expedient to serious consideration, and for the general good of gentry and commons. Culpeper, Thomas, Sir, 1626-1697.
24 p.
Printed by T.J. and are to be sold by Henry Million, London : 1673.
Attribured to Thomas Culpeper--NUC pre-1956 imprints. Errata: p. 24. Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
=======

24 p.
Printed by T.J. and are to be sold by Henry Million, London : 1673.
